class GrPixelBuffer

Definition at line 23 of file GrPixelBuffer.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum GrPixelBuffer::EFORMAT

Note: these orderings are chosen for performance. Typically, graphics cards store their data in BGRA format, with each color component comprising of a single byte. While this is hidden with textures, we denote this ordering explicitly here since direct access to pixel buffer content is allowed.

Enumerator:
EF_DXT1

Definition at line 31 of file GrPixelBuffer.h.

enum GrPixelBuffer::EUSAGE

Enumerator:
EU_STAGING  used to transfer data to the device.
EU_STAGING_STREAM  used to transfer data to the device. Data should be updated all of the time.
EU_STAGING_DISCARD  used to transfer data to the device. Data will not be preserved across context resets.
EU_READBACK  used to read data from the device.
EU_READBACK_STREAM  used to read data from the device. Data should be read-back all of the time.
EU_READBACK_DISCARD  used to read data from the device. Data will not be preserved across context resets.

GrPixelBuffer::EFORMAT GrPixelBuffer::GetMatchingFormat ( GrTextureBase::EFORMAT  textureFormat  )  [static]

class GrPixelBuffer

returns the matching format for a given texture format. If no matching format exists, EF_INVALID is returned.

void GrPixelBuffer::ReadPixels ( unsigned int  srcX,
unsigned int  srcY 
) const

public methods

reads pixels from the currently bound framebuffer. Note that a read must not go out of bounds from the current render target.

make sure the buffer isn't mapped!

verify that OpenGL is in a valid state going in and coming out of the readpixels call.
